intro: Iria angularis, commonly known as the angular iria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its angular, hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Iria angularis typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
